channel.title: Posts on krejac's notes
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on krejac's notes

item.title: The Search For Exploits
item.description: When doing pentesting you’re constantly looking for exploits. This is where I find mine. Shodan - Meta search, searches both exploitdb and metasploit (maybe more?). The Exploit Database - The classic from the makers of Kali Linux.1 Vulnerability & Exploit Database by Rapid7 the makers of Metasploit. SPLOITUS - A newcomer to the exploit scene, but worth keeping an eye on. Proven track record, but the reCAPTCHA is a bitch.

item.title: Blog Setup
item.description: I love setting up something new as I really appreciate the opportunity to ‘nerd out’ and try out new stuff and learn. I have previousely dabbled with different types of static site generators, Jekyll, Octopress, Bashblog and Chisel to name a few. But this time I wanted to try out Hugo. Hugo Hugo was super easy to install with apt on Linux Mint and brew on macOS taking care of any potential dependencies (apt install hugo and brew install hugo respectively).

item.title: Security Oriented Podcasts
item.description: The security oriented podcasts I listen to regularly are: SANS StormCasts - the quick no-nonsense daily fix. Smashing Security - the familiar weekly chat about cybercrime, hacking, and online privacy. Malicious Life - Listen to tales from the annals of cybersecurity and cyberwar from time to time. Also worth mentioning (but not yet regular on my list): Risky Business Cyber Security Sauna

item.title: Hello Friend
item.description: “Hello, friend?” That’s lame. Maybe I should give you a name… But that’s a slippery slope. You’re only in my head. We have to remember that… Shit. It’s actually happened. I’m talking to an imaginary person. â€” Mr. Robot S01E01
